--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> I'm w=
ith David on being intrigued by the idea of using arbitrary 
> classes. How=
ever, I'm much more interested in experiences than in 
> votes. If someone =
said, "I went through my code and I could 
> definitely use classes as cate=
gories because of X, Y and/or Z," would 
> be compelling to me. Even more c=
ompelling is if someone would write 
> the test cases for the new scheme.

=
Just skimmed through two of my OS projects. 80% of the test cases refer to =
a single class under test. For about 20% of those CUTs I have more than one=
 test class; those could benefit most since the naming convention doesn't h=
elp to show the connection. 

The follow-up question is: What would I do wi=
th this meta info?

Johannes
